mav_sim.chap12.rrt_dubins module¶

rrt dubins path planner for mavsim_python

mavsim_python

  • Beard & McLain, PUP, 2012

  • Last updated:

    4/16/2019 - RWB 12/21 - GND

class mav_sim.chap12.rrt_dubins.RRTDubins¶

Bases: object

RRT planner using Dubin’s paths as motion primitive

collision(start_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], world_map: MsgWorldMap, radius: float) → bool¶

Check to see of path from start_pose to end_pose colliding with world_map

Parameters:

  • start_pose – starting point on a line

  • end_pose – ending point on a line

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • radius – minimum radius circle for the mav

Returns:

True => a collision has occured, False => path is collision free

Return type:

collision_flag

draw_tree(tree: MsgWaypoints, radius: float, color: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → None¶

Draw the tree in the given window

Parameters:

  • tree – Current set of waypoints in rrt search tree

  • radius – minimum radius circle for the mav

  • color – color of tree

extend_tree(tree: MsgWaypoints, end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], Va: float, world_map: MsgWorldMap, radius: float) → bool¶

Extend the tree in a random direction

Parameters:

  • tree – Current set of waypoints in rrt search tree

  • end_pose – Desired end pose, used for goal checking and for altitiude

  • Va – airspeed

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • radius – minimum radius circle for the mav

Returns:

True if new node connects to the goal, false otherwise

Return type:

flag

plot_map(world_map: MsgWorldMap, tree: MsgWaypoints, waypoints: MsgWaypoints, smoothed_waypoints: MsgWaypoints, radius: float) → None¶

Plots the RRT tree

Parameters:

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • tree – Current set of waypoints in rrt search tree

  • waypoints – Non-smoothed, minimum length path

  • smoothed_waypoints – The path (waypoints) after smoothing

  • radius – minimum radius circle for the mav

points_along_path(Del: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Returns a list of points along the dubins path at a given spacing

Parameters:

Del – angular spacing of the points along the path

Returns:

Points along path between start and end pose

Return type:

points

smooth_path(waypoints: MsgWaypoints, world_map: MsgWorldMap, radius: float) → MsgWaypoints¶

smooth the waypoint path

Parameters:

  • waypoints – The path to be smoothed

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

update(start_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], Va: float, world_map: MsgWorldMap, radius: float) → MsgWaypoints¶

Update the plan using fillets for basic motion primitives

Parameters:

  • start_pose – starting pose of the mav

  • end_pose – desired end pose of the mav

  • Va – airspeed

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • radius – minimum radius circle for the mav

Returns:

Waypoints defining the planned path

Return type:

waypoints

mav_sim.chap12.rrt_dubins.column(A: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], i: int) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Extracts the ith column of A and return column vector

mav_sim.chap12.rrt_dubins.distance(start_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → float¶

compute distance between start and end pose

Parameters:

  • start_pose – pose one

  • end_pose – pose two

Returns:

distance between start and end poses

Return type:

d

mav_sim.chap12.rrt_dubins.find_minimum_path(tree: MsgWaypoints, end_pose: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → MsgWaypoints¶

Find the lowest cost path to the end node

Parameters:

  • tree – Current set of waypoints in rrt search tree

  • end_pose – Desired end pose of the path

Returns:

The shortest path

Return type:

waypoints

mav_sim.chap12.rrt_dubins.height_above_ground(world_map: MsgWorldMap, point: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → float¶

find the altitude of point above ground level

Parameters:

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • point – location to calculate height

Returns:

Height at the position (A negative value implies a collision)

Return type:

h_agl

mav_sim.chap12.rrt_dubins.mod(x: float) → float¶

force x to be between 0 and 2*pi

mav_sim.chap12.rrt_dubins.random_pose(world_map: MsgWorldMap, pd: float) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Generates a random oriented pose in the world.

The generated pose is generated randomly in the 2D plane with the down element (altitude) fixed

Parameters:

  • world_map – definition of the world for planning

  • pd – The down position (i.e., altitude)
